attributes.action: Call for Early General Election - damages reversal needed
attributes.additional_details:
New Government must reverse damaging changes impacting hard-working people. Priority reforms: 
1) Raise income tax thresholds - no tax up to £20K, 20% to £70K, 30% to £150K, 40% above. 
2) Remove NI tax on private pensions from April 2029. 
3) Significantly cut welfare spending on non-workers. 
4) consider Increase VAT to 23% on most goods. 
5) Introduce tiered VAT rates - e.g., 8% on building supplies to stimulate growth and fairness.
attributes.background: Call for early general election. The current budget crisis and unsustainable burden on hard-working taxpayers funding benefits for non-workers must end. Working families deserve a government that rewards work, not dependency. Let voters decide now.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign the following petition, which calls for similar action:

Dissolve Parliament and call a General Election now!
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/750050
